definitions.definition: To personally verify that (someone or something) is safe, copacetic, appropriate or satisfactory.
definitions.example: I sent Tom to check on the northside's branch's progress.

definitions.definition: To verify a specific fact; to quickly examine a situation, especially to look for updates or new information on a topic that has previously been discussed.
definitions.example: Have the price-tags been updated? I'll check on that right away, sir.
